background: This will be done to evaluate incubation success to the pre-emergent stage and help assess the kokanee spawning habitat. Eggs will incubate over the winter and evaluation will occur during the following spring. Upon completion, data collected at the incubation site will be compared to incubation success rates from other locations in the lake that were determined duringprevious studies. This direct measure of kokanee egg to pre-emergent fry survival is one aspect of determining the quality of spawning habitat.
title: LPO Kokanee Egg Incubation Study (1994-047-00)
assumptions: This research assumes that the conditions encountered by eggs burried in Whitlock-Vibert boxes by divers are equivalent to conditions encountered by eggs naturally deposited into the substrate by kokanee.
objectives: Use direct measures to better understand kokanee egg incubation and egg-to-fry survival.
